geometry.planar

Class RationalVector

  • java.lang.Object
    • geometry.planar.Vector
      • geometry.planar.RationalVector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class RationalVector
extends Vector
implements java.io.Serializable
    Analog RationalPoint, but implementing the functionality of a Vector instead of the functionality of a Point.
    Version:
    $Id: $Id
    Author:
    Alfons Wirtz
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • RationalVector

        public RationalVector(java.math.BigInteger p_x,
                      java.math.BigInteger p_y,
                      java.math.BigInteger p_z)
        creates a RetionalVector from 3 BigIntegers p_x, p_y and p_z. They represent the 2-dimensional Vector with the rational number Tuple ( p_x / p_z , p_y / p_z).
        Parameters:
        p_x - a BigInteger object.
        p_y - a BigInteger object.
        p_z - a BigInteger object.

      • side_of

        public Side side_of(Vector p_other)
        Let L be the line from the Zero Vector to p_other. The function returns Side.ON_THE_LEFT, if this Vector is on the left of L Side.ON_THE_RIGHT, if this Vector is on the right of L and Side.COLLINEAR, if this Vector is collinear with L.
        Specified by:
        side_of in class Vector
        Parameters:
        p_other - a Vector object.
        Returns:
        a Side object.

      • projection

        public Signum projection(Vector p_other)
        The function returns Signum.POSITIVE, if the scalar product of this vector and p_other > 0, Signum.NEGATIVE, if the scalar product Vector is < 0, and Signum.ZERO, if the scalar product is equal 0. The function returns Signum.POSITIVE, if the scalar product of this vector and p_other > 0, Signum.NEGATIVE, if the scalar product is < 0, and Signum.ZERO, if the scalar product is equal 0.
